document.masterDocTitle: On Chinese Trachyphloeini with description of four new species (Coleoptera, Curculionidae, Entiminae)

figureCitation.captionText: Figures 1 - 8. Scale bars: 1 mm.

Figures 26 - 35. Figures 26 - 35. Figure 52. Geographical distribution of new species and new record of Rhinodontodes in China.

subSubSection.paragraph: Mongolia • 1 ♀; 40 km W Dalanzadgad, Gobi Gurvansaikhan NP, Yolyn am env.; 28-30 Jun. 2003; 1700-2000 m a.s.l.; Z. Jindra leg.; RBSC; • 2 ♀♀; Bayan-Chong, Aimak, Ich-Bogdo-Ula, srednegorie [central mountains]; 2500 m a.s.l.; 3 Jul. 1973; G. Medvedev leg.; ZIN.

The eighteen specimens examined of
R. subsignatus
come from Mongolia and also from China, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The four males and 11 females from China differ somewhat from the three females from Mongolia, which share with the holotype slender, subparallel-sided, semi-erect elytral setae, while material from Mongolia has wider, subspatulate, semi-appressed elytral setae. Mongolian and Chinese specimens are almost identical in all other characters thus we assume the shape of elytral setae is a variable character of the species. This is the first record of
R. subsignatus
from China (Fig. 52 ).
